intro: Mentzelia albicaulis var. veatchiana, commonly known as the whitestem blazingstar, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its tall, slender stem and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological significance in its native range.
